item.title: To authorize the Administrator of General Services to convey a parcel of real property to the Alaska Railroad Corporation.

latestAction.text: Provisions of Measure Incorporated into Title IV, Section 401 of P.L. 110-244, (H.R. 1195)..

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7077)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S7076-7077)

summary.text: Requires the Administrator of the General Services Administration (GSA) to convey all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the GSA Fleet Management Center (located in Anchorage, Alaska) to the Alaska Railroad Corporation in exchange for: (1) suitable replacement property and such other consideration as agreed to; or (2) payment of fair market value. Requires any proceeds received to be deposited into the Federal Buildings Fund.

bill.title: A bill to authorize the Administrator of General Services to convey a parcel of real property to the Alaska Railroad Corporation.

item.title: A bill to authorize the Administrator of General Services to convey a parcel of real property to the Alaska Railroad Corporation.
A bill to authorize the Administrator of General Services to convey a parcel of real property to the Alaska Railroad Corporation.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7077)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
